src:
Kurti: Srpska lista neće biti deo nove Vlade Kosova

06 Nov 2019, 20:30

Lider Samoopredeljenja i budući premijer Kosova Aljbin Kurti izjavio je da Srpska lista neće biti deo nove vlade Kosova, ali da će jedan ministar, kako je propisano Ustavom, biti iz srpske zajednice na Kosovu."Poštovaću Ustav, ali pravim sadržinsku razliku izmedju toga kada je nešto ustavna obaveza, i politička koalicija s druge strane. Trudimo se da pravimo vladajuću koaliciju gde neće biti potrebni glasovi Srpske liste. Srpska lista biće u opoziciji, a to što jedan ministar mora da bude iz srpske zajednice, ne znači da će biti u koaliciji. Srpska nacionalna pripadnost nije članstvo partije nego nacionalna pripadnost", izjavio je Kurti u intervjuu za TV N1.Upitan da li to znači da će u budućoj kosovskoj vladi biti srpski ministar sa kojim će se složiti dvotrećinski Srpska lista, ali neće u političkom smislu biti tretiran kao deo vladajuće koalicije, Kurti je kazao da se "može tako reći".Kurti je istakao da još nije razgovarao sa predstavnicima Srpske liste i dodao da ih "neće ekskomunicirati u Skupštini i da su oni poslanici", ali da smatra da u opštinama sa većinski srpskim stanovništvom nije bilo fer i slobodnih izbora.Kako je naveo, bilo je slučajeva da je jedan Srbin glasao 18 puta kao i primera da je u nekim mestima bilo više glasova za Srpsku listu nego stanovnika."Posmatrači su rekli da su se kršenja izbornog procesa desila u sredinama gde posmatrači nisu bili Albanci, ali je odgovornost na kosovskim institucijama", rekao je.Kurti je kazao da je do tih pojava došlo usled pritiska zvaničnog Beograda da Srpska lista dobije 100 odsto glasova što je opisao kao posledicu "nedostatka samopouzdanja"."Imate pritisak i stravične diktature ne samo u Evropi i drugde u svetu koje bi se zadovoljile sa 80 odsto, a ovi su želeli 100 odsto. Ali ne krivim ja Srpsku listu, oni prebacuju pritisak koji sami doživljavaju, odnosno pritisak Beograda na Srpsku listu se prebacuje na pritisak na srpsko stanovništvo na Kosovu", istakao je on.Odgovarajući na pitanje zašto eliminiše Srpsku listu, Kurti je rekao da "Beograd plaća za poslušnost" i da kosovske institucije sa medjunarodnom zajednicom moraju da prekinu mogućnost da Beograd vrši pritisak na Srbe na Kosovu."Nemam ništa protiv Srba. Problem sa Srpskom listom nije to što je sredstvo Beograda, već što je sredstvo", ocenio je on.Kurti je naveo da očekuje da će mandat za formiranje kosovske vlade dobiti ovog meseca, i da će imati 15 dana za formiranje koalicije s Demokratskim savezom Kosova. "Do sada smo usaglasili oko 80 odsto planova i programa, posle toga ide podela resora ministarstava, a težimo tome da imamo 12 ministarstava, samo po dva zamenika ministara, i najmanje 30 odsto žena", rekao je Kurti. Takse na robu biće zamenjene reciprocitetnim merama Predsednik Samoopredeljenja i budući premijer Kosova Aljbin Kurti izjavio je da će takse od 100 odsto na robu iz Srbije biti zamenjene reciprocitetnim merama koje će Kosovo uvesti Srbiji."Reciprocitet je pravi princip zdravih konstruktivnih odnosa. Utvrdićemo registar, listu svih elemenata koji se tiču reciprociteta sa Beogradom", kazao je Kurti u intervjuu za N1.Kako je objasnio, reciprocitet znači da Srbiji treba prvo da učini nešto na nekom drugom polju pre nego što Kosovo ukine takse čime bi dijalog Kosova i Srbije bio nastavljen.Govoreći o dijalogu o pitanju Kosova, on je rekao da će njegova vlada početi prvo dijalog sa Srbima sa Kosova, i to dijalog o ekonomskom razvoju, a ne o pomirenju."Šta će nam to, meni Srbin iz Gračanice nije uradio ništa, niti ja njemu. Ako pitaš Srbe ili Albance na Kosovu šta im treba, ono što će svako reći jeste posao i pravda, i to treba da bude prioritet", istakao je.Kurti je dodao, razgovoraće i sa visokim predstavnikom EU za spoljnu i bezbednosnu politiku Žozepom Borelom i dodao da dve strane treba da se sastanu u Briselu."Dijalog ću voditi ja kao budući premijer, imaću svoj tim na dva nivoa. Prvi će biti političko predstavništvo gde će biti i oni iz opozicije, i drugi tim eksperata jer će biti raznih aspekata budućeg sporazuma. Ali najvažnija su tri principa prvi je da ne bude sporazuma bez dijaloga, drugi da nema dijaloga sa mapama, gde se predsednici prave da su vojni generali u ratu, a treći da nema predsednika oko mape, nego samo da budu eksperti o demarkaciji", istakao je Kurti. Kako je objasnio, to će pomoći da se razgovori prebaci iz "ambicija i apetita za teritorije" jedni drugih ka pravu gradjana i potrebama zajednice i naveo da je razgraničenje za njega rasistički koncept koji ne prihvata."Uvek će biti Albanaca i Srba na obe strane granice. Demarkacija da, ali ne razmena teritorija. Jer razmena teritorija nije dijalog za mir već dijalog koji vodi ka budućim konfliktima", kazao je Kurti..On je rekao i da ne veruje da će sporazuma doći već sledećeg proleća."Nema pomirenja bez poverenja, potrebno je poverenje a toga nema, jer se pravimo 'hajde da se saglasimo o vrednostima', a nismo saglasni o činjenicama rata, u koji smo svi bili uključeni. Neohodno je da se slažemo o vrednostima, ali za pomirenje nam treba saglasnost o činjenicama", istakao je Kurti. Razočaran sam kosovskim institucijama koje nisu rešile ubistvo Ivanovića Predsednik Samoopredeljenja i budući premijer Kosova Aljbin Kurti izjavio je da razočaran kosovskim institucijama koje još uvek nisu uspele da reše ubistvo Olivera Ivanovića i istakao da taj slučaj predstavlja "mnogostruki neuspeh".U intervjuu za N1 Kurti je kazao da će se kao budući premijer zalagati da institucije Kosova i medjunarodne zajednice reše to ubistvo."Sa ubistvom Olivera Ivanovića prvi put se desilo u istoriji Kosova da je ubijen Srbin na Kosovu, a da nije bilo nijednog Srbina na Kosovu da kaže da su to uradili Albanci, to je prvi put. Jako je čudno da u Severnoj Mitrovici gde ima najviše kamera po kvadratnom metru, nije moguće utvrditi ko je to počinio", kazao je on.Objašnjavajući zašto Ivanovića smatra ratnim zločincem, Kurti je rekao da je to tvrdio i Bernar Kušner u svojoj knjizi, a "on je dobro poznavao situaciju jer je bio šef Unmika 2000. godine"."Ivanović je bio medju čuvarima mostova… on nije krio da je bio u paramilitarnim jedinicama", dodao je Kurti.Kurti je rekao da će se zalagati da se svi zločini na Kosovu istraže."Prošlost ne prolazi lako i da je ona uvek i u sadašnjosti, a da bismo krenuli sigurno dalje prema miru u regionu i budućnosti ka EU, moramo da se sučeljavamo sa prošlošću, bilo je zločina na Kosovu prema Srbima, i ja ću se zalagati za to, jer zločin ne zastareva, da imamo normalne sudove koji će osuditi i Albance koji su ubijali Srbe", istakao je on. Albanska zastava je stara, ali će zastava Kosova biti u premijerskoj kancelariji "Albanska zastava je veoma stara i: Da, ima dosta istorije, zastava Kosova će biti u premijerskoj kancelariji", izjavio je budući kosovski premijer Aljbin Kurti odgovarajući na pitanje novinara N1 zašto u prostorijama drži zastavu Albanije, a ne Kosova."Kad su usvojili zastavu Kosova, nije bilo ni demokratije ni istorije u toj zastavi, nego geografije. Na taj način je albanska zastava postala zastava otpora", kazao je on tokom intervjua.Kurti je dodao da je on po nacionalnosti Albanac, da ne postoji nacionalni indentitet "kosovara" ali da postoji država Kosovo.Govoreći o pitanju ujedinjenja Kosova i Albanije, on je rekao da evropske integracije i ujedinjenje "niti mogu da zamene jedno drugo, niti se protive jedno drugom".
text:
Kurti: The Serbian List will not be part of the new Kosovo Government

06 Nov 2019, 19:30

Self-determination leader and future Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti said the Serb List would not be part of the new Kosovo government, but that one minister, as required by the Constitution, would be from the Serb community in Kosovo. "I respect the Constitution, but I make a substantive distinction between when something of a constitutional obligation, and a political coalition on the other hand. We are trying to create a governing coalition that will not require the votes of the Serb List. The Serb List will be in opposition, and having one minister must be from the Serb community does not mean that they will be in the coalition. "Serbian nationality is not party membership but nationality," Kurti said in an interview with TV N1. Asked if this means that there will be a Serbian minister in the future Kosovo government who will agree to a two-thirds Serb list, but will not be politically treated as part of the ruling coalition, Kurti said he "could say so." Kurti said he had not yet spoken to representatives of the Serb List and added that "they will not be excommunicated in the Assembly and that they are MPs", but that he believes that there were no fair and free elections in the municipalities with majority Serb population. As he stated, there were cases that one Serb voted 18 times and examples that "In some places, there were more votes for the Serb List than residents." Observers said violations of the electoral process occurred in areas where observers were not Albanian, but the responsibility lies with Kosovo institutions, "Kurtty said. the emergence came from pressure from official Belgrade to get the Serb List 100 percent of the vote, which he described as a consequence of a "lack of confidence." "You have pressure and terrible dictatorships not only in Europe and elsewhere in the world that would meet 80 percent, and these wanted 100 percent. But I do not blame the Serb List, they are shifting the pressure they are experiencing, that is, Belgrade's pressure on the Serb List is shifting to pressure on the Serb population in Kosovo, "he stressed. Asked why he was eliminating the Serb List, Kurti said that" Belgrade is paying for obedience, "and that Kosovo institutions with the international community must stop the possibility that Belgrade is putting pressure on Serbs in Kosovo." I have nothing against Serbs. The problem with the Serb List is not that it is Belgrade's tool, but rather that it is an instrument, "he said. Curti said he expects to receive a Kosovo government mandate this month and will have 15 days to form a coalition with the Democratic Alliance of Kosovo. "So far, we have approved about 80 percent of plans and programs, followed by division of ministries, and we aim to have 12 ministries, only two deputy ministers, and at least 30 percent women," said Kurti. Reciprocity Measures President of Self-determination and Kosovo's future Prime Minister, Albin Kurti, said that 100 percent of Serbia's goods would be replaced by reciprocal measures that Kosovo would introduce to Serbia. "Reciprocity is the true principle of sound constructive relations. We will establish a registry, a list of all elements related to reciprocity with Belgrade, "Kurti said in an interview with N1. As he explained, reciprocity means that Serbia needs to do something in another field first before Kosovo abolishes fees, which would allow Kosovo dialogue Speaking about the dialogue on the Kosovo issue, he said that his government would first start a dialogue with the Kosovo Serbs, not a dialogue on economic development, not reconciliation. "What, the Gracanica Serb did not do to me?" nothing, neither did I to him. If you ask Serbs or Albanians in Kosovo what they need, what everyone will say is business and justice, and that should be a priority, "he said. Curti added that he would also talk with EU foreign policy chief Josef Borel and added that the two sides should meet in Brussels. "I will have a dialogue as the future Prime Minister, I will have my team on two levels. The first will be a political representation where there will be those from the opposition, and the second a team of experts as there will be various aspects of the future agreement. But the most important three principles are the first is that there is no agreement without dialogue, the second is that there is no dialogue with maps, where presidents pretend to be military generals at war, and the third is that there is no president around the map, but only to be experts on demarcation, " He explained that it would help shift the talks from "ambitions and appetites for territories" to each other's rights to the citizens and the needs of the community, stating that dividing him was a racist concept he did not accept. "There will always be Albanians and Serbs." on either side of the border. Demarcation yes, but no territorial exchange. Because the exchange of territories is not a dialogue for peace but a dialogue leading to future conflicts, "said Kurti. He also said that he did not believe that the agreement would come as early as next spring." There is no reconciliation without trust, trust is needed and there is no, because we are called 'let's agree on values', and we are not in agreement on the facts of the war, in which we have all been involved. It is necessary to agree on values, but to reconcile, we need agreement on the facts, "Kurti said. I am disappointed with Kosovo institutions that have not solved the murder of Ivanovic to solve the murder of Oliver Ivanovic, pointing out that the case was a "multiple failure." In an interview with N1, Kurti said that as future prime minister, he would advocate that the institutions of Kosovo and the international community solve the murder. " Kosovo's history of killing a Serb in Kosovo without any Serbs in Kosovo saying it was done by Albanians is the first time. It is very strange that in North Mitrovica, where there are the most cameras per square meter, it is not possible to determine who did it, "he said. Explaining why he considers Ivanovic a war criminal, Kurti said that Bernard Kouchner claimed in his book, and "he knew the situation well because he was the UNMIK chief in 2000." "Ivanovic was among the guardians of the bridges ... he did not hide that he was in paramilitary units," Kurti added. Kurti said he would advocate that all crimes be committed. "The past does not go easily and that it is always in the present, and in order to move safely further to peace in the region and the future towards the EU, we must face the past, there have been crimes in Kosovo against the Serbs, and I will advocate for it because the crime does not become obsolete, that we have normal courts that will convict Albanians who killed Serbs, "he stressed. The Albanian flag is old, but the Kosovo flag will be in the prime minister's office" The Albanian flag is very old and: Yes, there is a lot of history, the Kosovo flag will be in the prime minister's office, "said future Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti when asked by N1 reporters why he holds the flag of Albania and not Kosovo on the premises." When they adopted the Kosovo flag, neither was democracy or history in that flag, but geography. In this way, the Albanian flag became the flag of resistance, "he said during the interview. Curti added that he is an Albanian by nationality, that there is no national identity of" Kosovars "but that there is a state of Kosovo. Speaking about the issue of unification of Kosovo and Albania, he He said that European integration and unification "can neither replace nor oppose each other".
